intro: Diospyros ferrea f. globosa, commonly known as the globular persimmon, is a shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean. It is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces small, round, orange-red fruits that are typically涩 (astringent) when unripe but become sweet and edible when fully mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas and disturbed soils. The species is valued for its ornamental appearance and historical use in traditional medicine.
